titles.title: Financial Crimes Accountability Act of 2008
A bill to establish a Special Joint Task Force on Financial Crimes.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary.

bill.summary: 10/1/2008--Introduced. Financial Crimes Accountability Act of 2008 - Directs the Attorney General to establish within the Department of Justice (DOJ) a Special Joint Task Force on Financial Crimes to: (1) provide direction for the investigation and prosecution of financial crimes (i.e., fraud, misrepresentation, or malfeasance involving financial products); and (2) make recommendations to the Attorney General and the President on allocating resources and coordinating governmental efforts to investigate and prosecute financial crimes.
